meanings.definition: Moving with quick, small side-to-side motions.
meanings.sent1: The waggly puppy happily wagged its tail.
meanings.sent2: The waggly leaves rustled in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent3: The waggly dance of the scarecrow made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: The waggly branches of the tree seemed to wave hello.
meanings.sent5: The waggly squirrel darted across the yard, its tail flicking back and forth.

meanings.definition: Having a tendency to wag or shake.
meanings.sent1: The waggly dog's tail wagged excitedly when its owner returned.
meanings.sent2: The waggly curtain fluttered in the breeze from the open window.
meanings.sent3: The waggly toy on the dashboard bobbed up and down as the car drove over bumps.
meanings.sent4: The waggly flag on the ship fluttered proudly in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The waggly hair of the old man swayed as he walked, giving him a carefree look.
